title: 4th Grade Math - Addition and Subtraction Assessment
standard: 4.PAFR.1.1 Use a strategy to accurately compute sums and differences of whole numbers up to 100,000 and justify the sum or difference.

questions.stimulus:
The Palmetto City Zoo tracks its visitor attendance every year. The table below shows the total number of visitors for the last four years. The zoo also has a goal to reach 100,000 visitors in a single year.

| Year | Total Visitors |
| :--- | :--- |
| Year 1 | 45,820 |
| Year 2 | 51,065 |
| Year 3 | 49,118 |
| Year 4 | 53,709 |
questions.stem: How many more visitors did the zoo have in Year 2 than in Year 1?

questions.stem: The zoo's goal was to have a combined total of at least 95,000 visitors for Year 1 and Year 3. Did they meet this goal? Show your work and justify your answer.
questions.sampleAnswer: No, they did not meet the goal. 45,820 + 49,118 = 94,938. The number 94,938 is less than 95,000. They were 62 visitors short of the goal (95,000 - 94,938 = 62).
